I got this phone for myself (Verizon, black) It looks brand new
Pretty pleased so far
The phone arrived yesterday, so I haven't had a lot of time with it
I chose the seller I did (CertifiedDevices) based on reviews
The phone arrived well packaged, in a plain white box, with charger and the little pin-thing for opening the SIM card slot
The phone does have a couple tiny nicks on it, on the bottom bezel
They are covered by my phone case and I do not mind them
The screen seems to be in excellent condition

This does use the C-adapter for charging, and I had none of those, other than the one that came in the box (not a complaint, just an observation for anyone going from a phone using the micro-USB port charger)
In 12 hours the battery has gone from 100% charge to 59% charge while off the charger, which seems pretty decent to me
Your results may vary based on how you use the phone
Phone did not have a SIM card with it, I did not expect one as those are phone-service-provider specific
Most cell phone companies will provide one free or for a few bucks
I use Verizon; I removed the SIM card from my old phone and inserted it in the new phone, and turned it on and has been working fine in this first 24 hours
After putting the SIM card in and turning on the phone, it verbally walked me through some simple steps, automatically, and voilà, this is now my working phone
Many standard apps updated automatically, and I chose some apps to install right away
After a few hours, the phone wanted to do some operating system updates; I think it went through two iterations of updating the phone
After this, I used the Samsung Smart Switch app to transfer/copy apps from my old S7 to my new S9+
I chose which apps I wanted copied
Turns out Samsung Smart Switch does not also copy over the credentials, so I still had to open the apps to set up my access
It seems just about all the apps have their own notification settings, and most default to making noise!So far I am very happy with the seller and the phone they sold me
Some of my comments have no bearing on the seller or the condition of the phone, but just the experience I've had with the Samsung S9+, in case they're of help to anyone

Amazon Renewed description very inaccurate!  Avoid CR Daily Deals!
My phone died and I was on vacation
I purchased this Amazon Renewed device on 7-30 so it would be waiting at home when we got home on 8-2
The order was placed with CR Daily Deals and it arrived on 8-1
Imagine my disappointment when I opened it Friday and noticed all the chips and scratches
The front of the phone has a lot of scratches and chips in the top right
They are very noticeable when the phone screen is off
The back of the phone has several scratches on the middle right and is chipped up around the camera, flash and fingerprint area where someone has a case on it and it got beat up around the opening
One side of the phone has a chip on the black surface that is noticeable since you can see the metal under it
The description for Amazon Renewed states clearly The products have no visible cosmetic imperfections when held 12 inches away
These scratches and chips are very noticeable more than a foot away
I put my sim card in and the phone did work on Verizon
Thus far the phone has operated as intended and everything appears to be fine

Amazon either needs to adjust the description to state the phone may have scratches on the front, back and side noticeable at arms length or more or put CR Daily Deals on notice or remove them from this item
Phone works fine, but highly disappointed a paid top dollar for a phone is such poor shape
Unfortunately I cannot go without a phone again waiting for a return
I could have gotten this same phone in this condition much cheaper on Swappa!I overpaid and feel ripped off based on the condition!

I will start with the negative aspects of buying this used/renewed phone
While the product description said The device does not come with headphones or a SIM card
Solution = Additional purchase of a compatible Adaptive Fast Charger
Solution = Upgrade to latest Android 10 yourself after you are fully setup with your carrier
My phone also came with a curved hard screen protector added
Solution = Remove the protector
Those are my only downsides to this renewed product experience
Now for the positives
Fingerprint reader and HR sensor: 10/10 - Fingerprint reader is fast and works perfectly
Phone exterior: 9/10 - Rear is very clean and seems to have less scratches than the glass
I can confidently say buying Amazon Renewed is worth doing

I think I am in love again
I have been a Samsung phone user for many years now
I also have a Samsung TV, Blu-Ray player, and sound bar
I love my Samsung products
I bought this S9+ renewed to replace my S8 that was dropped one too many times and is pretty cracked on the screen and back case
It still works, mostly, but it was time to upgrade
I love the S9+
The only negative so far is because it is an unlocked phone, I do not have some of the ring and alert tones I am used to and there is no Visual Voice mail
Lesson learned for next time
With the Samsung Smart Switch app, I was able to easily transfer all of my apps (along with data for most of them), all my photos/videos, and most of my settings
The ringtones were an issue due to the unlocked phone
I love the bigger screen, the faster processor, and the overall features of the the S9+
And now that it is on Android 10, that annoying Bixby page is gone and replaced with something that is infinitely more useful
I was worried about battery life, but so far the battery is quite a bit better than my S8's ever was
I can go all day for about 12 to 14 hours with a decent amount of use and still have 50% battery life remaining
My S8 would have needed to be on a charger long before this one
Unfortunately I have not really given the camera a workout yet
If you are looking for an updated phone but don't want the extra expense of the S10, then I highly recommend the S9+
It's close in size to the Note series, has extra onboard memory, and the battery life is really quite good

The Phone Speaker was obstructed, simple fix.

Not sure when it happened, either during the manufacturing or the refurbishment process a plastic film is left over the speaker grill you hold up tp your ear resulting in the inability to hear a call unless on speaker phone
After a few youtube videos recommending cleaning with a toothbrush did not solve the problem one instructed to use a needle to open the obstructed grill holes, it worked like magic
This was easier than sending it back as by the time I discovered this fault much time had been spent formatting the phone

Got this phone because my pixel3 was not at all what I had hoped for and was having terrible call quality issues amongst other things
This phone is a HUGE step up from my pixel3

The screen is gorgeous, call quality is miles better, the battery lasts, the camera is almost just as good (which means it's pretty good) and most of all it came in almost perfect condition even though it was a refurbished phone

The only cons about this purchase I can think of are:- There was a very small notch- like scratch on the screen in the top right corner which is only noticeable under certain light, or when the phone is off
When I plugged my Google Fi sim card, it worked instantly but could not get the latest software updates (Android Pie)
To summarize, this is a great value for something that is still going to compete in the market for the next few years as a top device
It actually has more RAM than the pixel3 even though it is a generation older
Just make sure that when you order it refurbished from Amazon that you understand exactly what you are getting
No fancy box, no extra accessories, just a solid device

After some investigation, i found out that the ROM is Android 8
So i tried to update the phone to Android 10 myself which did not work because of lack of skill on my part loli took it to a local shop
When the technician turned it on for the first boot after flashing, the picture attached to this review showed up
The fingerprint reader is now working as well
I am happy with my purchase but cannot give a buy recommendation

Don't Buy - Poor Quality Inspection at Your Expense
I have purchased many cell phones in the last 30 years
This was the first, and the last, refurbished phone I purchased
Metro PCS store simply installed a SIM card and activated service
I put it in an OtterBox case (wallet case with a soft rubber surround)
When looked at a few days later, the screen had a crack in the lower right corner, which subsequently but slowly crept up into the center of the screen
It was submitted and accepted for refund
So far, so good, tight?While I explained the entire scenario in the refund request, the refund was decremented by 26% of the purchase price
Why would there be a Re-stocking fee on a cracked phone?It was either my fault (100% decrement) or the sellers (0%)
Clearly the inspection missed a chip or the like on the phones surface
It was never dropped or even handled much
I will never purchase another phone through this seller

3.5 stars, no vertical adjustment, and a really sticky mess on the surface you put it on.
Something that I want to mention right off the bat which I did not know before purchasing these

I put this product on my windshield, and the same day I proceeded to take it off, and even though the suction was dismantled, the sticky adhesion made this thing stuck on to my windshield, it was a mess!I had to take a credit card to carefully pry the suction cup off!So I would suggest if you are going to place this somewhere in your car, prepare for it to be semi-permanent, and when you plan to remove it, be prepared for it to leave a sticky residue/mess behind
In addition, another flaw is that the vertical cradle is not adjustable, only the side horizontal wings to accommodate width of the phone
With how elongated newer phones are (21:9, 19:9 ratios), it makes the device less stable and secure when positioned side ways
All in all, it works, but the sticky residue/mess that the suction cup leaves behind, and the non adjustable vertical cradle part is something to be aware of

Unlocked is the way to go...
This is my very first unlocked phone
This phone is very durable when covered in a good protective case and a good screen protector
As far as the 3 day battery life, I haven't experienced that
I'd recommend this phone to anyone who's done with all the carrier's preloaded apps and want a quality phone without spending hundreds of dollars
Not a bad inexpensive phone, for light app users.
It only has Android 10 and there will only be one OS update to Android 11
This limited OS update is unacceptable to me and I went with a Pixel so I could get the latest OS
I really wanted a superior camera, but the stacked 16MP sensor is not any better than any other 12 or 16MP sensor that outputs JPEG files
The phone is fairly fast, but if you have a lot of apps, it slows down
If you want a better phone expect to pay twice as much, but if you need a decent phone, use a few apps, and don't care to have the best camera, then get this phone
Awesome budget phone
Update (1-13-2022): recent software updates seems to o have resolved previous issues

5 hours of screen time and 14% battery left on Friday night

Over conclusion: incredible purchase for $250
If you want long run on a charge, hard to beat, especially at this price
Bought it for the battery life, and it delivers -- under my current usage pattern I can go 2-3 days between charges
Minimum manufacturer nonsense software; it's pretty close to being stock Android 10

IT HAS A PHYSICAL HEADSET JACK

Not the fanciest phone on the market
Over 300 wallpapers and awesome sound quality!

Increased performance, photo, & video - decreased bat. life
I had the Moto G7 Power 2019 version, and I bought this version to upgrade that older phone
The pictures come out very clear and detailed, the videos are very good quality (mp4), the phone is very fast - even with multiple apps open at once, etc
The only thing I've noticed that is a slight difference (in performance) is the battery life
The 2019 model definitely lasts longer than this one; however, the 2019 model also does not take as good of pictures or videos, and it also is nowhere near as fast, so everything is a trade-off
A buddy of mine was looking to upgrade his phone, and I recommended this one to him (he used mine to get a feel for it), and he bought one as well, and likes it as well

In my opinion, you really can't go wrong with this phone, as long as you're just looking to use it to use Maps, texting, simple web browsing (like looking at Amazon for something to buy for example), taking pictures or videos, etc
I run Linux (Xubuntu 20
04 LTS), and this phone connects seamlessly to my computer
All I have to do is select File Transfer from the notification drop-down item, and it shows up without any issues
I also helped my buddy set up his phone, and he runs Windows 10, and this phone connected just fine to that as well
If this review helped you, please give me a thumbs up
First Week Review
First Note: I’m switching from a Moto E4 to the Moto G Power 2021
The E4 began life as a Verizon prepaid offer that I switched to AT&T
I was considering switching back to Verizon but the signal and call quality on the unlocked Moto G Power 2021 has been a big improvement so I think I will leave it on AT&T prepaid
All I had to do to switch to the new phone was move the prepaid AT&T SIM from the old phone to the new
Android 10 or Motorola’s implementation of it has been a challenge to get used to
I was hoping for a $200 upgrade on the camera but that is a disappointment
The touch recognition of app shortcuts is inconsistent
The screen seems to turn dark in the sunlight
The signal and call quality is the only thing that makes this phone a keeper

Except for one Nokia phone before the analog-to-digital conversion, I have always had Motorola phones
They have great battery life, and have always lasted at least 3 years
I was easily able to set up my new phone, including reinstating 3-button navigation)
Its battery life is fantastic
The fingerprint sensor is my biggest complaint
I added four different fingerprint scans, but it doesn't work at all unless I pick up the phone
Even then it only works about one time in four
My old phone, which was a Moto G6 Plus, had the fingerprint sensor located in front, at the bottom of the screen, so I could easily turn on the screen without picking up the phone
It almost always worked on the first try
I really miss that
Facial recognition: Thumbs down
I set it up; it recognized me once, so I know the set-up was successful, but it never worked again
Phone size, weight, and shape: This phone is not comfortable for me to hold in my hand
It is too large and too heavy
I hold it in my right hand and scroll with my left (southpaw), and after 2 weeks I noticed that my right thumb was permanently numb
That was not an issue with my G6 Plus, and I have been using my new phone less
I compared the two phones, and found three differences in size, shape, and weight: this phone is almost 1/4 taller, and it weighs 7
3 oz vs the G6 Plus's 5
The case is also more squared-off at the top and bottom
I guess those changes were just enough to cause me problems
I was planning to get a case for it, but I haven't, because that would make it even bulkier and heavier
If I can find a smaller budget Android phone with a decent battery, I will be returning this one
It is definitely going back
Bad antenna design
Constantly get Not connected to Cellular Network when you try to make a call
No Wi-Fi calling option
I like the phone features (coming from Moto X4) but if you can't make calls it is useless
I actually had the same problem on two of these Moto G Power 2021 phones
Reordered phone to see if problem was unit specific but no, the second phone had same problem
If you reboot the phone you magically get normal signal strength (bars) and then can place your call
So it's NOT a cell tower coverage problem
Both going back
What a waste of time!
A modern electronic device shouldn't be this difficult
I gave this a one-star review, which is admittedly a little harsh
The phone looks nice, takes perfectly fine photos, plays videos and music, etc
The reason why I'm giving it such a negative review is because certain features are simply broken
The first problem is that this phone won't send or receive texts when you first start it up
This problem is fixable
After googling it, I dutifully contacted Verizon, changed a couple of settings, and now texting works just fine
But a phone should be able to send a receive texts right out of the box
If somebody like my parents had purchased this phone, they would have been lost, and there's really no excuse for making your customer fix your product on their own own
The second problem is that this phone refuses to connect to my employer's secure wifi network
It connects to my home wifi and various public networks no problem
But it absolutely will not connect to our secure network
Our IT people tell me that this is a known issue with Motorola phones caused by some recent software changes, and they're pretty confident that they'll eventually get it to work
But again, the important thing is that a modern phone should just work, right out of the box
My old phone, my tablet, and my laptop all connect to our wireless without issue
It's just this phone that doesn't
Probably we'll get a software patch in the next few weeks, everything will work correctly, and I'll forget that this was ever an issue
But in 2021 I think we shouldn't expect electronic devices to be this fussy, so Motorola gets one star only
Do better next time

Its an LTE (4G) unit - same as my G6, but I don't need the 5G capability and the price difference to get better streaming is ridiculous
That said, Moto only provides one upgrade, so I got 11 installed even though 12 was available at time of purchase
I wanted the battery and the processor, and I'd recommend this unit to anyone who wants a great phone/camera for a reasonable price

Excellent Phone for the Money
My wife and I had Moto E4 phones and they served us very well

6 screen, a fast and responsive OS, good sound clarity, a decent camera, and a great battery life, it has all you'd need in an everyday smartphone as another reviewer said “you're probably not going to do better than this one for what it costs” And, I would totally agree with that
Inexpensive but good value.
I bought mine directly from Motorola based mostly on the claim of 3 day battery life
My normal usage left me at 50% battery life at 5pm after a full charge overnight
If you want 3 days you will have to compromise
That said, this is a great bargain phone
The screen is big, bright and snappy
The fingerprint reader responds quickly and accurately
The chassis is sturdy and attractive
Turbo charging went from 8% battery to 100% in about 2
Motorola has included some unique gesture functions that I like
Move the phone in a chopping motion turns the flashlight on and off
Twisting activates the the camera even if the phone is locked
My only other complaint so far is that the back cover is slick when held, but adding a Spigen case fixed that
Excellent budget phone - unlocked 4Gb RAM / 64Gb
I got this phone as a backup on a MVNO ( GSM + CDMA )
Decent Phone for the Price
This phone was definitely surprising for the price
overpriced at $240 and feels dated for mid-level phone
I bought this to replace a ZTE Blade 10 ($150) that had a flaky bluetooth connection
I have liked ZTE phones for a while, but took a chance on the Motorola at $80 more to see if it was worth it
On the plus side, RAM is respectable and battery life is the biggest advantage
The bluetooth as fine, as you would expectc
The camera is comparable to the ZTE, meaning that it's not terrible but a far cry from flagship quality
zoom will pixelate so it's truly only acceptable for daylight conditions near subjects
The biggest disappointment is the lack of NFC
As a few others did, I missed it
you'd have to scroll all the way down on phonearena to see it and even then there is no No
I assumed that every phone over $200 in 2021 would have an NFC chip as basic functionality (as did my $150 ZTE)

I am not somebody who needs all the bells and whistles on my phone, but I will admit that using the NFC feature turned out to be a technology and convenience that I appreciated, and it feels weird to go back to the Stone Age
First world problems for sure, but still
it feels like I got less bang for my buck
I wish I spent more money on a Pixel
if you're going to upgrade over another mid-level phone, make sure it has everything and more!
A letdown from previous models
I had a Moto G7 Power that was awesome, but upgraded to the G Power 2021 because it was AT&T and I switched to Verizon
Best android for the money in my opinion
I came from LG phones to this after seeing a 2020 Power my friend had
The sound out is INCREDIBLE
Poor voice and LTE signal reception
I bought this device directfrom Motorola
The camera continues to suck and its AI is laughable - especially at night
However this wasn't the worst problem
So ONE MONTH after I bought the Moto G Power (2021) I wanted rid of it

I should say that in strong signal areas the Moto G Power (2021) worked fine, both voice and data, so I have to suspect that Motorola made design compromises to extend battery life (which, btw, is superb)
Finally I should add that most of the Motorola phones (at the lower and mid levels) come with Android 10 which is already out-of-date
So overall this phone has only two strong points
Extremely difficult to do what for other phones would be extremely easy tasks
There are good aspects of this phone such as having a long battery life

I have listed three different issues below that are all gargantuan problems with the Moto G Power phone but were complete nonissues as in literally were very simple tasks that would take no more than a few seconds to complete on every other phone that I ever owned
Needless to say, I am not pleased with needing to waste truly phenomenal amounts of time whenever I want to do a very basic elementary task
I will never buy a Motorola phone again
For example, for the past 65 minutes or so I have been trying unsuccessfully to transfer photos to my computer
With the Moto G Power I need to go deep into the phone settings in order to change a setting that is grayed out so cannot actually be changed

I have changed that setting every single time I have transferred files over the course of owning this phone and every time it was a very long and arduous process that simply could not be done without reading numerous online articles in order to figure out very complex workarounds for the phone failing to allow any reasonable path to accessing the files
Sometimes this has taken multiple hours of continuous struggle in order to perform this simple task that shouldn't even take 2 seconds
This is not a matter of my not remembering how to do it
I definitely do
It is just that every time this phone makes it even more complicated and roundabout then it was before to perform this very basic task
I really need the space today as I am planning to go to an important event today and I need to make videos of it

I don't want to delete the videos I already have without being able to back them up first so it looks like I will need to go to the store and waste lots of money buying a new device that actually works because my Moto G Power phone simply refuses to allow me to transfer the files
If in theory it does deign to let me do the file transfer it will probably be after several hours of fooling with it, but I frankly don't have that kind of time
This is beyond frustrating

Another major problem with this phone is that unlike other phones if you stick an SD card in it the phone will need to erase all the contents of the SD card before it will allow it to save files there

I have a 128 GB SD card plugged into the phone and on previous phones when the space filled up on the phone it would either automatically start saving to the SD card instead or it would ask me if I wanted to do that
No such options happened with the Moto G Power phone but I can manually set it to save the files there but only if I allow it to erase the 20 GB of data that are already saved on my SD card
A third issue is that unlike every other phone I ever owned, the Moto G Power phone's SIM card and SD card cannot easily be removed
There is a little gadget resembling a paperclip that needs to be inserted into the phone in order to open the tray that contains those cards
This gadget comes with the phone and is very small and easy to lose and is definitely not the sort of thing that is intuitive to carry with you in your daily life or to bring on trips
Without that little gadget it is impossible to remove the SIM card or the SD card
Shortly after I bought this phone I went on a hike where I feared it might get wet so I put the SIM card back in my old phone for what I had intended to be that one day
That turned out to be a good idea since my old phone did get wet on that trip so the new phone was not damaged
I had to spend the next 5 weeks using my old phone while searching my apartment extensively for that little gadget
I tried paperclips, toothpicks, and various other similarly shaped objects to try to open the tray but nothing worked
I eventually found that little gadget and was able to open the phone to put the SIM card back in
It actually turned out that the gadget was in plain site on my desk the whole time
I had searched it dozens of times over the course of 5 weeks but it was so tiny that I somehow missed it all those previous times and had to look at just the perfect angle in order to see it
None of that should have been necessary
With any other phone I have ever owned I could open it up very easily by hand and would not need to fool around for over a month trying to find a little gadget like that
In summary, this phone is a complete pain to use

It may not seem like that initially, but whenever you really need it, it will not be there and instead of just telling you that, you will need to waste several hours of time in order to find out that it just isn't going to function
I will never buy a Motorola phone again and regret owning this one
My previous phone was Samsung
I will buy another Samsung phone much earlier than anticipated in order to be rid of this nonsense

According to Motorola, this phone does not support wifi calling with Verizon
I did not buy this phone from Amazon, though I sort of wish I had
I live in what might charitably be called a 'fringe area', which means cell coverage is at best, poor, and often non-existent
Because of that, I need wifi calling, and when looking for a new phone, this one says it does support wifi
When the phone arrived, I began the process of setting it up but to my frustration, I could not seem to find how to activate wifi calling
I finally called customer service and asked how to enable wifi calling on the phone
I was told that my carrier (which does support wifi calling on my phone plan) does not support wifi calling on Moto G phones
I asked if wifi calling was supported on this model phone by other carriers, and was told that only one supported it
Basically the Moto G phones seem to be good phones at a reasonable price, but for me, this makes the phone unuseable to a degree that I find unacceptable for my needs
If you do not need wifi calling, it is probably a good choice

I will definitely purchase their phones in the future

Changing my perspective on expensive phones
I have purchased 3 BLU phones for my teenage son
Being a teenager, he tends to break his phones (hence the 3 phones), so I wasn't willing to purchase the expensive mainstream phones
BLU seemed a great cheap alternative for him
Each new phone I get for him (the X6 being the latest), my perspective has changed on BLU
These phones have been great for him, and even would be great for me
Sure they aren't fully equivalent to the mainstream flagship phones, but they are really close
As an average everyday user of a phone for calls, texts, playing games, basic pictures and surfing the net, the X6 would completely meet my needs
The next time I am ready to upgrade, will seriously consider switching to BLU

Blu is the GOAT!
I don't have this new X6 model, but I've owned at least three Blu phones that were octacore
They are super-fast online, they are tough, and they have every function you could possibly want- all at a price that's at least half of the usual brands like Samsung, LG, etc

The only reason I ever had to get a new one is because I dropped a Blu Life One X2 about 30 feet onto a concrete platform; I accidentally drove my full-size Chevy truck over the second Life One X2, and I lost a Blu Vivo XL5 (yes, I have bad luck with phones!)Anyway,our teenager has a Samsung S10+ that cost AT LEAST a thousand bucks when we bought it, and I can't tell much of a difference in the functioning between the Blu phones and the Samsungs
I am AMAZED that more phone companies don't offer these phones as prepaids or as contract phones
They are remarkable for the price
My next phone will definitely be some sort of Blu model, and every phone I ever purchase will be Blu for as long as they are produced
The best models I can find have an octacore, at least 64gb, and at least 3gb or 4gb RAM

If you don't want to charge the battery constantly, make sure it's at least 4,000mAh (this is generally true for any brand, from what I've experienced over my MANY years of life!)Oh, you can usually get ALL of this for around $100 if you buy a Blu
I've gotten some TERRIBLY slow, junkie phones that were wayyyyy more that a hundred-dollar bill!Blu is really the best of the best when you consider performance, features, and price
I won't buy any other brand!

The Android Pie Build Absolutely Sucks

I’ve had at least 5 previous BLU phones over the years and each one always has some quirks, but this X6 Vivo seems to really be lacking in comparison to previous phones they’ve released at the $110-$140 price point
First thing to notice is it has a slightly slower processor than the previous Vivo 4
The built in speaker is not loud
Rings and alarms have to be ALL the way up 59 hear them
That wasn’t an issue with the Vivo 4
The barebones Android Pie build they use for the OS is a PIG on battery life
Even with the size of the battery, it COOKS through your battery if you’re spending large periods of time on the phone
All of a sudden both the SMS notifications have gone silent as well as the timer on the clock

I’ve spent HOURS online toggling switches, and reading internet forums and I’m ready to do a factory reset on the handset in an attempt to get it to MAKE SOUND when a text comes in or a timer goes off
There’s only 4 ringtones and 4 notification sounds

I have some experience with these phones, so will probably flash it and continue to tweak in an effort to get it dialed in but considering it will probably only last me a year, I shouldn’t really have to do this
I’m SERIOUSLY considering not buying another BLU phone in the future

The idea that the OS is a buggy nightmare out of the box, the volume is much lower than any BLU I’ve ever had, the connectivity of the wi-fi sucks, and I’m having issues getting tones from a phone that supposed to ring is an glaring indictment on both the Android Pie build and the rollout and support of this model
Unreliable, and BLU won't be there for you when something goes wrong.

I bought the Vivo5 in September 2019 and was happy to have found a budget-friendly phone ($80 on sale) with sufficient storage for apps (No more deleting old apps to install new ones!)That said, the phone was unreliable, and BLU wasn't there to support me when my phone began abruptly turning off just two weeks after the manufacturer's warranty expired in September 2020
5 weeks before I received my phone
This was the only solution BLU would give me
5 weeks without a working phone is costly too
But BLU was ultimately inflexible in their solution to my problem: The only option they gave me was to send my phone to them for a second round of repairs; no refunds whatsoever
Maybe I've grown accustomed to rapid service and delivery after shopping mainly at Amazon and Costco for so many years
Do not buy this
First of all, I don't know why I am directed to this product
3 Infinity Display, 128GB+4GB RAM and Triple Camera

The phone is good but it would kick me out of wifi (at home with Comcast Xfinity):and use up data limits

No VOIP
Be careful when buying a Blu Phone
They do not work for VoLTE or internet/WiFi calling
While calls on the regular carrier network, like T-mobile work fine, you are in trouble in a weak signal area
The brand name phones usually allow VoLTE or VOIP calls
You cannot do this with a Blu phone, so calls cannot be made or received in weak signal areas

Changing my perspective on expensive phones
I have purchased 3 BLU phones for my teenage son
Being a teenager, he tends to break his phones (hence the 3 phones), so I wasn't willing to purchase the expensive mainstream phones
BLU seemed a great cheap alternative for him
Each new phone I get for him (the X6 being the latest), my perspective has changed on BLU
These phones have been great for him, and even would be great for me
Sure they aren't fully equivalent to the mainstream flagship phones, but they are really close
As an average everyday user of a phone for calls, texts, playing games, basic pictures and surfing the net, the X6 would completely meet my needs
The next time I am ready to upgrade, will seriously consider switching to BLU

Blu is the GOAT!
I don't have this new X6 model, but I've owned at least three Blu phones that were octacore
They are super-fast online, they are tough, and they have every function you could possibly want- all at a price that's at least half of the usual brands like Samsung, LG, etc

The only reason I ever had to get a new one is because I dropped a Blu Life One X2 about 30 feet onto a concrete platform; I accidentally drove my full-size Chevy truck over the second Life One X2, and I lost a Blu Vivo XL5 (yes, I have bad luck with phones!)Anyway,our teenager has a Samsung S10+ that cost AT LEAST a thousand bucks when we bought it, and I can't tell much of a difference in the functioning between the Blu phones and the Samsungs
I am AMAZED that more phone companies don't offer these phones as prepaids or as contract phones
They are remarkable for the price
My next phone will definitely be some sort of Blu model, and every phone I ever purchase will be Blu for as long as they are produced
The best models I can find have an octacore, at least 64gb, and at least 3gb or 4gb RAM

If you don't want to charge the battery constantly, make sure it's at least 4,000mAh (this is generally true for any brand, from what I've experienced over my MANY years of life!)Oh, you can usually get ALL of this for around $100 if you buy a Blu
I've gotten some TERRIBLY slow, junkie phones that were wayyyyy more that a hundred-dollar bill!Blu is really the best of the best when you consider performance, features, and price
I won't buy any other brand!

The Android Pie Build Absolutely Sucks

I’ve had at least 5 previous BLU phones over the years and each one always has some quirks, but this X6 Vivo seems to really be lacking in comparison to previous phones they’ve released at the $110-$140 price point
First thing to notice is it has a slightly slower processor than the previous Vivo 4
The built in speaker is not loud
Rings and alarms have to be ALL the way up 59 hear them
That wasn’t an issue with the Vivo 4
The barebones Android Pie build they use for the OS is a PIG on battery life
Even with the size of the battery, it COOKS through your battery if you’re spending large periods of time on the phone
All of a sudden both the SMS notifications have gone silent as well as the timer on the clock

I’ve spent HOURS online toggling switches, and reading internet forums and I’m ready to do a factory reset on the handset in an attempt to get it to MAKE SOUND when a text comes in or a timer goes off
There’s only 4 ringtones and 4 notification sounds

I have some experience with these phones, so will probably flash it and continue to tweak in an effort to get it dialed in but considering it will probably only last me a year, I shouldn’t really have to do this
I’m SERIOUSLY considering not buying another BLU phone in the future

The idea that the OS is a buggy nightmare out of the box, the volume is much lower than any BLU I’ve ever had, the connectivity of the wi-fi sucks, and I’m having issues getting tones from a phone that supposed to ring is an glaring indictment on both the Android Pie build and the rollout and support of this model
Unreliable, and BLU won't be there for you when something goes wrong.

I bought the Vivo5 in September 2019 and was happy to have found a budget-friendly phone ($80 on sale) with sufficient storage for apps (No more deleting old apps to install new ones!)That said, the phone was unreliable, and BLU wasn't there to support me when my phone began abruptly turning off just two weeks after the manufacturer's warranty expired in September 2020
5 weeks before I received my phone
This was the only solution BLU would give me
5 weeks without a working phone is costly too
But BLU was ultimately inflexible in their solution to my problem: The only option they gave me was to send my phone to them for a second round of repairs; no refunds whatsoever
Maybe I've grown accustomed to rapid service and delivery after shopping mainly at Amazon and Costco for so many years

No VOIP
Be careful when buying a Blu Phone
They do not work for VoLTE or internet/WiFi calling
While calls on the regular carrier network, like T-mobile work fine, you are in trouble in a weak signal area
The brand name phones usually allow VoLTE or VOIP calls
You cannot do this with a Blu phone, so calls cannot be made or received in weak signal areas

I do most of everything computer wise on my tower/ home pc
I built an awesome system for a little over $2k including monitor, mouse, keyboard, &speakers
From my experience a tower computer has about a 10 year life-span before it starts having problems
A middle ranged GPU & CPU won't be outdated even for gaming within that decade, but if you want to upgrade you're looking at another $1K within the lifespan of the computer
Still at the end of the decade half of the value of the computer will remain reusable; the case, hardrives, power supply, adapters, & so one
It's a waste of money in contrast to be spending a thousand dollars a year on a piece of shit smartphone that can't do 10% of what a tower can do

The phone maybe cheap but its not worth the loss of privacy and ultimately the Trojans render the phone unusable

It is pre-loaded with adware that cannot be removed: banner ads as well as full-screen ads

Some Googling showed that others have had the same experience with the same pre-installed adware

One Amazon review from three months ago referencing the adware even has a response from BLU: acting as if they didn't know the adware -- that took me less than 10 minutes to track down -- came installed on phones they themselves sell
Absolutely disgusting
I have gone ahead and changed all passwords for all accounts accessed through this phone: if there's adware, spyware is not an unrealistic concern

The phone I received is an a705-MN
Great value. Huge screen. Fast. Works on T-Mobile pre-paid.
S10 specs at half the price point
The specs are on par with the Galaxy S series at half or over half the cost depending on S10 version
I opted for the white one because of the specs listed for the bands it can use
I know it should not matter what the color is on the outside, but the black and blue A70s did not list as many bands as usable
That was not just on the listing here, but other places I searched
I didn't want to take a chance of getting one that may or may not work on AT&T in this area so got the one I knew would
It has a battery larger than the ones in other Samsung S series phones I've had so it has no problem lasting all day
If I were to somehow wear the battery down before the end of the day I don't see where it would be a problem because it is VERY fast charging
I have also forgotten to charge it overnight a couple of times and still had enough to run through the second day without a boost
No it does not share power to other devices as the S10 series, but I was not looking for that option anyway
The screen is very bright and flat (THANK YOU)
I never was a fan of the edge screen on the S series but Samsung never gave an option for them with a flat surface instead of the edge screen
That actually was part of the reason I pulled the trigger on this model

I haven't had any more problems seeing it in bright sunny areas than any other phone I've ever had and don't have to deal with the annoying edge that could at times glare when the reset of the screen did not
This A70 has a single downward firing speaker like 99
It has an option to turn on Dolby Atmos if you plug in headphones but I have not tried that so cannot comment beyond the fact the option is there
The same it true with NFC (have not tried it)
It is not an option on many economy phones but is on the A70 if that was a concern for you
When I first started using this phone I would sometimes just give up and swipe the screen to enter my PIN to unlock
I have since found that it will not always recognize your print if you have dirt on your finger (or screen) and are not in exactly the right spot for the full print
I'm not sure if this has anything to do with the screen protector I put on it so it could be in part my fault
It still have to try 2 or 3 times on occasion even after that, but again could be the protector I put on it so I did not remove any stars for it
Overall I highly recommend this phone to any budget minded shoppers looking for a great phone at a reasonable price for a very high end mid-level device that performs like a top tier flagship

The short review- Buy this phone
The UI:To me, the Android UI has always felt a little rough around the edges when comparing it to the refined design of IOS

The Screen:Amazing! I can see why Samsung is the exclusive display supplier for Apple'sX line of phones (X, XR, XS, XS Max) Apple's marketing team calls it a Liquid Retina Display but the rest of us call it an FHD+ Super AMOLED display
The Specs:TheQualcomm Snapdragon 675 Octa-Core processor, 6GB of RAM, 128 GB ROM, AND an additional 128GB Micro SD card included in the box, make this a powerful combo
The camera(s) 32
0 MP provide great detail easily rivaling or exceeding that of my iPhone 7, and on the front

a 32MP selfie camera!Audio- I purchased a pair of Anker Soundcore Bluetooth earbuds back when was using an iPhone; the sound quality was OK and you definitely needed to EQ your music when using them but now that I'm using them with the A70 and the Dolby Atmos processing, music, movies, and podcasts sound so much better! (non-technical exaggeration here) like 80% better!Size- It's a big one! about as wide as my iPhone 7Plus but taller, this makes it much easier to hold; and for the most part, you're in two-handed usage territory here anyway
The ONLY Downside so far- The in-screen fingerprint reader
My suggestion? Just use face unlock if it's too slow for you
Additional recommendations: Anker Soundcore Bluetooth Earbuds, and the SunRemex Carbon Fiber Designed Galaxy A70 Case, a perfect combination IMHO
That's it for now- I'll report back in about a month to add if anything changes

Touch screen going black from bottom up after just two months
This phone worked well initially
The display is great indoors and in sunlight
However just a dayago the three buttons on thebottom return, home button etc started workingintermittently
Also some characters on the keyboard especially on the right side stopped working e
Eventually the screen just went black
I tried the reset procedure - down volume with power key - no dice
Then all three keys - volume up, down power
At one time the screen flashed the startup Samsung logo then went dead
Apart from an occasional vibration there was nothing
I plugged it in just to make sure that thebattery was not fully discharged
This was unlikely as this phone has always held charge well
I normally charge my phone overnight and when I put this to chargebefore going to bed it is usually still at 70% plus charge
Still nothing
My daughter suggested I just leave it to let the batterygo fully dead and try to charge again, but next morning it just came back alive with a touchof the power key and a swipe
So I thought that we were back but no suchluck
First a bright white line appeared on the right side then an hour or so later a second followed by a green line in between
Next the bottom of the displaystarted to get obscured by a purple tone witha full blackout following
This is a dud
Just two months after $339!Really!Samsung should replace this!This is my third Samsung phone and I amafraid it will be my last
